
Intercepted comms from agent Blum use RSA with a secret twist—his moduli are products of twin primes. Crack the code: 498150141336539427349271259471973825861336450864756876446087729576106993997604164063143194537950391287411418432135381619552358569552873816024589803788930

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{gq1y8qgp}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 498150141336539427349271259471973825861336450864756876446087729576106993997604164063143194537950391287411418432135381619552358569552873816024589803788930
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5874277937678554331753868853951876607687351515320757217878163514177113588450897544593863206935572859081629833567057406006539910079980996677607376999141077, e=2926544957711685309799314938025475883475656634494954388273043398774598530756772949565733732528384440413558348789538674844481979428613000111323424873918609
